-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@=
yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
Of Dan Smyth
Sent: Friday, June 30, 2006 3:20 PM=

To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [cantera] negative_A reaction option =
returning nan

Hi,

I have successfully installed Cantera onto my Linux box=
 and am trying to
replace numerous Chemkin subroutines in a code of mine wi=
th
corresponding Cantera calls.  I have translated a mechanism from the
Che=
mkin format into Cantera format by using the ck2cti program with the
verifi=
cation option and seemed to pass.  I'm calling
getNetProductionRates(wdot) =
from my program and am getting "nan" in
return for seven different species.=
  I have tracked the problem by
calling:

getFwdRatesOfProgress
getRevRates=
OfProgress
getFwdRateConstants
getRevRateConstants

and have found that the=
re are two reactions in my mechanism that are
returning a "nan" value.  The=
y are both reactions that have been
declared as duplicate reactions and the=
y also both have negative
pre-exponentials.  (These are the only reactions =
in my mechanism that
have a negative pre-exponential.)  My original Chemkin=
 mechanism file
had the following within it:

First Reaction:
NH+NO=3DN2O+H=
               2.94E+14  -0.40   0.000E+00
DUP
NH+NO=3DN2O+H              -=
2.16E+13  -0.23   0.000E+00
DUP

Second Reaction:
NH2+NO=3DN2+H2O          =
   1.30E+16  -1.25   0.000E+00
DUP
NH2+NO=3DN2+H2O            -2.80E+13  -0=
.55   0.000E+00
DUP

The listed reactions in the cti conversion of this mec=
hanism file look
like this:

First Reaction:
#  Reaction 77
#  10.5, 9 (a)
=
#  Miller & Melius, 24th Symp. on Comb., 1992.
reaction(  "NH + NO <=3D> N2=
O + H",  [2.94000E+14, -0.4, 0],
         options =3D ["duplicate"])

#  Re=
action 78
reaction(  "NH + NO <=3D> N2O + H",  [-2.16000E+13, -0.23, 0],
  =
       options =3D ["negative_A", "duplicate"])

Second Reaction:
#  Reacti=
on 90
#  10.6, 9 (b)
#  Glarborg et al., Int. J. Chem. Kinet., 26, 421, 199=
4.
reaction(  "NH2 + NO <=3D> N2 + H2O",  [1.30000E+16, -1.25, 0],
        =
 options =3D ["duplicate"])

#  Reaction 91
reaction(  "NH2 + NO <=3D> N2 +=
 H2O",  [-2.80000E+13, -0.55, 0],
         options =3D ["negative_A", "dupl=
icate"])

And the xml translation contains the following:

First Reaction:
=
    <!-- reaction 0077    -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D=
"yes" id=3D"0077">
      <equation>NH + NO [=3D] N2O + H</equation>
      <=
rateCoeff>
        <Arrhenius>
           <A>2.940000E+11</A>
           <b=
>-0.40000000000000002</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
    =
    </Arrhenius>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NH:1.0 NO:1</reactants=
>
      <products>H:1 N2O:1.0</products>
    </reaction>

    <!-- reaction=
 0078    -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" negative_A=
=3D"yes"
id=3D"0078">
      <equation>NH + NO [=3D] N2O + H</equation>
    =
  <rateCoeff>
        <Arrhenius>
           <A>-2.160000E+10</A>
         =
  <b>-0.23000000000000001</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
=
        </Arrhenius>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NH:1.0 NO:1</react=
ants>
      <products>H:1 N2O:1.0</products>
    </reaction>


Second React=
ion:
    <!-- reaction 0090    -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversib=
le=3D"yes" id=3D"0090">
      <equation>NH2 + NO [=3D] N2 + H2O</equation>
=
      <rateCoeff>
        <Arrhenius>
           <A>1.300000E+13</A>
      =
     <b>-1.25</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
        </Ar=
rhenius>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NO:1 NH2:1.0</reactants>
     =
 <products>N2:1.0 H2O:1</products>
    </reaction>

    <!-- reaction 0091 =
   -->
    <reaction duplicate=3D"yes" reversible=3D"yes" negative_A=3D"yes=
"
id=3D"0091">
      <equation>NH2 + NO [=3D] N2 + H2O</equation>
      <ra=
teCoeff>
        <Arrhenius>
           <A>-2.800000E+10</A>
           <b>=
-0.55000000000000004</b>
           <E units=3D"cal/mol">0.000000</E>
     =
   </Arrhenius>
      </rateCoeff>
      <reactants>NO:1 NH2:1.0</reactants=
>
      <products>N2:1.0 H2O:1</products>
    </reaction>

As far as I can =
tell everything has been converted correctly.  From what
I have found by lo=
oking around the available Cantera literature, the
only way that a negative=
 pre-exponential factor can be used inside
Cantera is for it to be declared=
 as part of a duplicate reaction, be
declared as having the option negative=
_A, and have the total overall
rate be positive.  Something is happening he=
re though, as the even the
rate coefficients are being returned as "nan" va=
lues.  This is
consistent with both the forward and reverse coefficients, a=
nd obviously
the forward and reverse rates of progress.  Am I understanding=
 all this
correctly?

As far as I can tell, I'm within the parameters set b=
y Cantera to use
negative pre-exponential factors, but I'm getting these bo=
gus values in
return, and am not sure (what to do)/(what to check) next.  D=
o you know
what might be wrong?  Is there something else that I can check t=
o make
sure that I'm doing things right?  Thanks.

Dan Smyth
